BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh wind slabs require caution. In addition the danger of dry and wet avalanches will increase as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh snow and in particular the sometimes deep wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant and generally at intermediate and high altitudes. These are to be found especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
In particular in the regions with a lot of snow more medium-sized and large dry and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation. The wind slabs of the weekend will become increasingly prone to triggering in particular on steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack. This applies in particular at intermediate and high altitudes and along the border with Switzerland.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls the wind slabs will increase in size from late morning. The snowpack will become in some cases unstable. Sunny slopes: As a consequence of rising temperatures and solar radiation a crust will form on the surface during the next few days.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: These conditions will facilitate a gradual strengthening of the snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The avalanche danger will increase a little during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The more recent wind slabs of the weekend must be evaluated with care and prudence. In particular gullies and bowls as well as places that are protected from the wind: These can in some cases be released by a single winter sport participant.
In particular on steep sunny slopes more dry and moist avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation. In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation more avalanches are possible as the day progresses, even large ones in isolated cases.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack. This applies especially at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, along the border with France.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to increasing moistening of the snowpack in some places on sunny slopes. Sunny slopes: As a consequence of sharply rising temperatures and solar radiation a crust will form on the surface during the next few days.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The avalanche danger will decrease gradually.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation more moist and wet avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The new snow and wind slabs of the weekend can be released naturally especially on steep sunny slopes. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase.
The wind slabs of the weekend are to be evaluated with care and prudence in particular in very steep terrain. In particular gullies and bowls as well as places that are protected from the wind: The fresh wind slabs can in some cases be released, in particular by large loads.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack. This applies especially at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, along the border with France.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to increasing moistening of the snowpack in some places on sunny slopes. Sunny slopes: As a consequence of sharply rising temperatures and solar radiation a crust will form on the surface during the next few days.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: These conditions will facilitate a gradual strengthening of the snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of natural wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep southeast and southwest facing slopes at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes above approximately 1600 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of natural wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep southeast and southwest facing slopes at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes above approximately 1600 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights:
Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with the old snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In the afternoon as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be a rapid increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. More frequent small to medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are to be expected below approximately 2800 m, in particular on very steep sunny slopes.
Since Sunday the wind has been strong in some localities in some regions. Particularly in the valley heads.
The soft wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in particular on northeast to southeast to southwest facing aspects above the tree line. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Friday above approximately 2000 m. In many places new snow is being deposited on bare ground (--), in particular on sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on very steep sunny slopes below approximately 2800 m.
The new snow and wind slabs are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack on rather lightly snow-covered shady slopes. Is lying on a crust on steep south, west and southeast facing slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of moist and wet avalanches will already exist in the early morning, in the event of an overcast night especially.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights:
Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with the old snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In the afternoon as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be a rapid increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. More frequent small to medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are to be expected below approximately 2800 m, in particular on very steep sunny slopes.
Since Sunday the wind has been strong in some localities in some regions. Particularly in the valley heads.
The soft wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in particular on northeast to southeast to southwest facing aspects above the tree line. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Friday above approximately 2000 m. In many places new snow is being deposited on bare ground (--), in particular on sunny slopes and at low and intermediate altitudes.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on very steep sunny slopes below approximately 2800 m.
The new snow and wind slabs are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack on rather lightly snow-covered shady slopes. Is lying on a crust on steep south, west and southeast facing slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of moist and wet avalanches will already exist in the early morning, in the event of an overcast night especially.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of natural wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep southeast and southwest facing slopes at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes above approximately 1600 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming, the natural avalanche activity will gradually increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of natural wet avalanches being released will increase gradually in particular on steep southeast and southwest facing slopes at intermediate altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to a loss of strength within the snowpack over a wide area in particular on steep sunny slopes above approximately 1600 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights:
Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
The wind slabs of the last few days are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In particular intermediate altitudes very steep sunny slopes: As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be a rapid increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. More frequent small and medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are to be expected, in particular on very steep sunny slopes,.
In the afternoon possibly danger level 3 (considerable) will be reached below approximately 2800 m. In localities where the night is overcast the danger will increase earlier.
Since Sunday the wind has been moderate to strong in particular along the border with France and along the border with Switzerland. Here soft wind slabs formed.
The wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant above approximately 2200 m. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
30 to 50 cm of snow has fallen since Friday above approximately 2000 m.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on very steep sunny slopes below approximately 2800 m.
The new snow and wind slabs are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack on rather lightly snow-covered shady slopes. Is lying on a crust on steep south, west and southeast facing slopes.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with the old snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of moist and wet avalanches will already exist in the early morning, in the event of an overcast night especially.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights:
Significant increase in danger of moist and wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.
The wind slabs of the last few days are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In particular intermediate altitudes very steep sunny slopes: As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation there will be a rapid increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. More frequent small and medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are to be expected, in particular on very steep sunny slopes,.
In the afternoon possibly danger level 3 (considerable) will be reached below approximately 2800 m. In localities where the night is overcast the danger will increase earlier.
Since Sunday the wind has been moderate to strong in particular along the border with France and along the border with Switzerland. Here soft wind slabs formed.
The wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant above approximately 2200 m. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
30 to 50 cm of snow has fallen since Friday above approximately 2000 m.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to rapid moistening of the snowpack over a wide area in particular on very steep sunny slopes below approximately 2800 m.
The new snow and wind slabs are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack on rather lightly snow-covered shady slopes. Is lying on a crust on steep south, west and southeast facing slopes.
In some cases the wind slabs have bonded still only poorly with the old snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The danger of moist and wet avalanches will already exist in the early morning, in the event of an overcast night especially.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The wind slabs represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The avalanche prone locations are to be found on steep shady slopes, and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Several medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible in the regions with a lot of snow. The new snow and wind slabs of the last few days can be released, especially by large additional loads,.
As a consequence of solar radiation the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The weather conditions facilitated a gradual strengthening of the snowpack. Weak layers exist in the top section of the snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases in particular on west to north to southeast facing aspects. Avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. At elevated altitudes and in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation such avalanche prone locations are more widespread. In some cases avalanches are medium-sized.

As a consequence of solar radiation individual loose snow avalanches are possible, but they will be mostly small.

Only isolated gliding avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs are lying on soft layers in particular on shady slopes above the tree line.

The snowpack will be moist below approximately 2200 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Wind slabs require caution. The weather conditions will bring about a stabilisation of the snow drift accumulations. As a consequence of solar radiation individual loose snow avalanches are possible.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The wind slabs represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The avalanche prone locations are to be found on steep shady slopes, and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
Several small and medium-sized avalanches are possible in particular above approximately 1800 m.
The new snow and wind slabs of the last few days can be released, especially by large additional loads,.
As a consequence of solar radiation the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The weather conditions facilitated a gradual strengthening of the snowpack. Weak layers exist in the bottom section of the snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet avalanches as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The mostly small wind slabs of the weekend can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases. This applies in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain in particular at intermediate and high altitudes.
As a consequence of warming during the day, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase in particular on steep sunny slopes. The new snow and wind slabs of the weekend can be released naturally especially on steep sunny slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
In some places new snow and wind slabs are lying on the smooth surface of an old snowpack. This applies especially at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions, along the border with France.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from early morning to increasing moistening of the snowpack in some places on sunny slopes. Sunny slopes: As a consequence of sharply rising temperatures and solar radiation a crust will form on the surface during the next few days.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The danger of moist avalanches will increase during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The danger of wet and gliding avalanches will increase during the day. Below approximately 2600 m small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible. The new snow of the weekend can be released naturally on very steep sunny slopes above the tree line. This snow can be released in isolated cases, but mostly only by large additional loads in all aspects above approximately 1800 m. The new snow of the last few days is very loosely bonded in particular on shady slopes above approximately 2000 m.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The new snow of the last few days is very loosely bonded in particular on shady slopes above approximately 2100 m. The snowpack will become moist on sunny slopes. In addition wind slabs will form in the vicinity of peaks as the day progresses.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Old wind slabs require caution. As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of moist avalanches will appreciably increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
More recent wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant. In isolated cases the avalanches are medium-sized. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep slopes above approximately 2000 m, and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist snow slides and avalanches are possible as the day progresses. This applies in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2400 m especially above the tree line. Avalanche prone locations for moist avalanches are to be found on steep southeast, south and west facing slopes. Mostly avalanches are only small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The new snow of the last few days is very loosely bonded in particular on northwest to north to east facing aspects and generally at intermediate and high altitudes. The fresh wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in all aspects and at elevated altitudes.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to softening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2400 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack over a wide area. As a consequence of solar radiation individual moist and wet avalanches are to be expected.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Old wind slabs require caution. As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of moist avalanches will appreciably increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
More recent wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant. In isolated cases the avalanches are medium-sized. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep slopes above approximately 2000 m, and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist snow slides and avalanches are possible as the day progresses. This applies in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2400 m especially above the tree line. Avalanche prone locations for moist avalanches are to be found on steep southeast, south and west facing slopes. Mostly avalanches are only small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The new snow of the last few days is very loosely bonded in particular on northwest to north to east facing aspects and generally at intermediate and high altitudes. The fresh wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in all aspects and at elevated altitudes.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to softening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2400 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack over a wide area. As a consequence of solar radiation individual moist and wet avalanches are to be expected.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Fresh wind slabs require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
More recent wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in isolated cases above approximately 2400 m. Avalanche prone locations are to be found on very steep northwest, north and east facing slopes, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas. Mostly avalanches are only small.

On extreme sunny slopes individual loose snow avalanches are possible, but they will be mostly small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Fresh wind slabs are in some cases prone to triggering on northwest to north to east facing aspects. This applies in particular on steep shady slopes adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. The older wind slabs of last week have bonded well with the old snowpack. The solar radiation will give rise to slight moistening of the snowpack on sunny slopes.

Intermediate altitudes: The snowpack will be moist. At low altitude only a little snow is now lying.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Old wind slabs require caution. As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of moist avalanches will increase.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
More recent wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant. In isolated cases the avalanches are medium-sized. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep slopes above approximately 2000 m, and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation moist snow slides and avalanches are possible as the day progresses. This applies in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2400 m especially above the tree line. Avalanche prone locations for moist avalanches are to be found on steep southeast, south and west facing slopes. Mostly avalanches are only small.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The new snow of the last few days is very loosely bonded in particular on northwest to north to east facing aspects and generally at intermediate and high altitudes. The fresh wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack in all aspects and at elevated altitudes.
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise from late morning to softening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2400 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather conditions will facilitate a gradual stabilisation of the snowpack. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to moistening of the snowpack over a wide area.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The snowpack will be generally well bonded.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Individual avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep shady slopes. Small avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: In particular on sunny slopes a little snow is lying.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: New snow at high altitude.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of new snow and wind individual mostly small avalanches are possible above approximately 1700 m. This applies especially in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, as well as on very steep slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The old snowpack remains subject to considerable local variations. At intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying. At high altitude mostly small wind slabs formed. In gullies and bowls the wind slabs are larger. Some fresh snow and the mostly small wind slabs will be deposited on a quite favourable old snowpack above approximately 1800 m.
